content.description: Scramble up on top of the boulder to the right of most routes at roadside and begin following the obvious line of darker bolts on the face. Pull the roof with a fixed permadraw, then continue on small holds to the anchors.
Brushy, run out, loose, anemic ledge.  The only reason to do this is to access the cave.  Mostly 5.0 with perhaps a move of 5.7.
content.protection: Few widely spaced bolts.  May have old fixed line but do not trust it.
content.location: 2nd pitch from top of Moly Mind.  Do not rap from high wall anchor with single rope.  Find anchor on rim below large boulder on west end of ledge.

content.description: The longest, cleanest route at the area. Start up in the small corner up the smooth, water polished face to the high first bolt. I presume one could go straight up the face avoiding the corner but it would be much more difficult and unprotected. A few more thin moves take you up past a couple more bolts and then into positive, fun climbing up to the roof.  Pull the roof using big holds and climb past a couple more bolts to an anchor. Lower from here if your rope is 60m or less and you want to TR.  Otherwise count your draws and make sure you have at least 6 more and keep going for more fun climbing with a short, thin crux just before the higher set of anchors.
content.protection: 14 or 15 bolts with the first set of anchors at about 75 feet. The higher anchors are at about 112 feet, and have fixed 'biners on them.
content.location: The right most route of the three on the main wall.     If you have a 70m rope you can lower with just enough rope to spare from the upper anchors. Otherwise, make two raps down to the ground.

content.description: Good, cruiser climbing up for about 30 feet to where the wall steepens.  The closely spaced bolts protect this steeper section perhaps because it's a crux or perhaps because the rock the bolts are set in isn't the greatest quality.    Gain a big horizontal crack and pull up onto the upper face of better rock. Fun, airy climbing above to the anchor.
content.protection: 12 bolts and a two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: The leftmost route on the main wall.  Lower or rap with a 60m rope.  Not sure a 50m rope would make it.

climbs.name: Moly Mind
climbs.fa: Joel Tinl, Jay Foley, Mike Howard

content.description: Tricky and continuous  a bit sharp and steeper than it looks.
content.protection: Bolts to chain anchor.  First bolt is a tad high (PG) but only 5.9 climbing.
content.location:
Large south-facing wall behind trees on north side of hwy. Located about 25 meters right of Roadside Distraction. Direct line with high first bolt.  Leads to bolted anchor at ledge under overhang. 

  For more adventure, may follow an old fixed line along traverse to large cave.  Loose, dirty, brushy, run-out...(Scare Way to Heaven, 5.4). This pitch leads to the Moly Mind Cave. The cave sits on a ledge as big as the parking lot below. Rap with TWO ropes from the LOWER anchor just below the big ledge on its West side. Look for rap below the large boulder on the ledge. SOME LOOSE ROCK. HWY DIRECTLY BELOW, PLEASE USE CAUTION.

content.description: Paw your way up a flake of sorts, clip the first bolt and mantle up onto it. Bust out some tricky pulling down, sideways and up on good rock the rest of the way to the anchor. I had a hard time identifying any one particular crux.
content.protection: 7 bolts and a two-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: The center and shortest route on the main wall. Rap or lower down.

content.description: Fun extension of Middle of the Road, continue up past the first set of anchors to some sidepulls and crimps to the second set of anchors at the top of the wall
content.protection: 14 bolts, 70m rope needed for one rap, or rap in two pitches

content.description: A nice granite crag with a car bumper belay. Roadside Distraction crag faces south and is shady and cold from December to early February, but is sunny the rest of the year.
